headline: Parmesan Fondue
description: You can have a warm, mild, and creamy fondue on your table in just moments by melting Neufchatel cream cheese and Parmesan cheese in milk.
name: Parmesan Fondue
recipeIngredient: 1 small loaf French bread, cut into cubes

recipeInstructions.text: Stir Neufchatel cream cheese in milk in a saucepan over medium-low heat until melted, 2 to 3 minutes. Add Parmesan cheese and garlic salt. Cook and stir until the Parmesan melts, 2 to 3 minutes more. Serve with bread cubes.

review.reviewBody: Fantastic recipe! But a full amount says "14 servings". We just finished this as dinner for 3 people!

This tastes good and has a nice flavor. I would definitely add more milk to thin it out. I felt this recipe was lacking in cheese and the usual texture from fondue. My family and I had a great time eating this for dinner but I think I’d prefer a traditional fondue next time.

This fondue is delicious, cheap to make (since it does not use very expensive cheeses), and super fast & easy to make! I followed the recipes written, except that based on reviews I read, I omitted adding any extra salt. Instead of garlic salt, i simply used 1 tsp of garlic powder (that had no salt in it). It was perfect, and i definitely would not want to add any extra salt flavor--- the natural salts in the cheese are enough. I was worried about it being lumpy, based on reviews i read--- but all you need to do, is use a WISK and the lumps dissolve quickly! I really feel like the wisk should've been mentioned in the directions, to help people handle the lumps. Note-- i cooked this all on the stove, and then transferred it to the fondue (and only used my fondue maker to keep it warm on a low setting), and that worked out great for me.
It was very easy and It’s sooooooooooooo good

I doubled this on New Year's Eve using half Parmesan cheese and half Asiago and it was delicious! I kept it warm in a little slow cooker and served it with French bread and rosemary focaccia squares and little carrots. My nephew loves Asiago cheese and he loved it.
This was delicious! I read the reviews and added two cups of Parmesan and more milk to stretch it out. I'm glad I did! This was gone and there was only three of us!

Absolutely delicious! Followed recipe exactly and it was the easiest creamiest fondue ever ! I happened to find at my store an Italian cheese mix that had provolone parmesean fontina and asagio in it and this gave the fondue a wonderful smokey flavor!
I can see how this might be good with some additional flavor. However, without any additions, it was bland, tasted like warm cream cheese, and lumpy. I won't be making it again.
So simple and so tasty. Thanks for sharing it.

I've been making traditional Swiss fondue for almost 30 years. This is not as good, but then it never claimed to be. I was looking for an inexpensive fondue alternative and I found a keeper. Because Parmesan cheese is high in salt to begin with, I used garlic powder instead of garlic salt. I also used regular cream cheese as that's what I had on hand. This turned out creamy and delicious. I served it with homemade bread and granny smith apples to dip. Both were delicious in this fondue. I will be making this again.
this was very easy to make and it tasted very good I would use a good strong aged cheese to get the flavor
Great! Serve with bread, baby carrots, and dill cornichon.
I dont like garlic, so I left that out. It was excellent!
Really good! I used mozzarella instead of neufchatel because I couldn't find it. I also used sourdough bread and that was great too. Very yummy recipe that I would make again.

It really is very easy... But not so good, I have tried and made many fondue recipes before and this one isn't one I would recommend... Tastes just like cream cheese, needs a kick of something.. It was also kind of lumpy..
My teenage girls love this. It is requested quite often in our home. Not just from my girls but from their friends also. I use regular cream cheese and it comes out perfect every time.

Doubled the recipe. Mixed it all up in the crock pot and called it good. Was a little skeptical that so few ingredients would taste good and I kept double checking that I didn't miss an ingredient, but it was my favorite at a fondue party that had 7 cheese dips to choose from. I used a focassia and a kalamata bread to dip. Super good. We also dipped meatballs, sausages, tortellini, veggies, bagels . . . You name it. Completely recommend.
Delicious! By the way isn't Neufchatel cheese just a low fat cream cheese?
Yum! Made a double recipe.

Super simple, super yummy..... my picky kids loved it! I liked the very creamy, parmesan flavor. Next time, I might switch up the parmesan for another favorite cheese flavor, just for fun - as suggested. But it's great as is!
I loved it. It tasted delicious.i added black pepper to it and that really did it
It was good and my family loved it too. It reminded me of a good Alfredo sauce that would be good on pasta too.
Good, but pretty salty. Easy to make, but the amount of salt for MY taste (and I do use plenty) was a lot. It was a hit with my guests, though...

This is so incredibly easy to make and so delicious. I omitted the garlic salt and used cream cheese rather than Neufchâtel cheese. I also would recommend buying a large loaf of French bread--and make sure it's really good bread, makes the fondue even tastier.
First try at fondue - extremely good!
Brought to a fondue party at work. Mine was the first to go. Instead of french bread, I had meatballs to dip.
Very easy, very good!
Really great! I always have to triple the recipe because it goes to fast!

We serve fondue every year on Christmas Eve. I'm experiment each year with a different recipe, because it's never been perfect, until now! This will be our new staple. It's delicious and easy. We had 9 people for dinner and ate it all, so I will double or triple next year. I served with little smokies, meatballs, French bread, carrots, broccoli, cauliflower and mushrooms. YUMMY!!!
Excellent recipe!
